security: Sharing the personal history statements could expose details about the individuals, such as their backgrounds, contacts, and any potential vulnerabilities. This could compromise their security and potentially expose sensitive information to unauthorized parties.
summary: Robert M. Curutingham requests copies of Personal History Statements for Myrtle V. Quine, David R. Wesy, Adolph R. Jane, and Helena V. Bimroty from the Security Branch, OSQ, for security checks because their current files do not meet the requirements of recent instructions.
summary_one_paragraph: On August 5, 1947, Robert M. Curutingham, Chief of the Security Branch, OSQ, sent a memo requesting ten copies of current Personal History Statements for Myrtle V. Quine, David R. Wesy, Adolph R. Jane, and Helena V. Bimroty because their existing files did not comply with recent instructions from the Assistant Director for Special Operations, indicating a need for updated security checks.
title: Request for Personal History Statements
